children.subject: consider taking 16b instead of math 110! I have not taken math 110 so i cannot speak to its content, but 16b has a bunch of concepts (clustering, SVD, k means, etc.) that is introduced to you in a similar manner that 189 introduces them--just at a slower pace. I thought it provided an easier transition into 189

history.content:
Context: Have taken Math 110, haven't taken EE127 but heard things about it

If the only objective of taking linear algebra classes is to use it for AI/ML, taking EE127 should be more than sufficient; Math 110 covers a lot of the more abstract material in linear algebra, such as deriving matrix multiplications and operations via linear transformations, but in itself does not give you much more preparation for AI/ML. 

If you're looking for classes that prepare you for 189 mathematically, consider looking at EE126/ Stat 140 alongside 127 instead.

If you're looking for classes that just boost your mathematical maturity in general, 110 is a good class for that purpose. However, there are other classes out there (Math 104, Math 113, etc) that will also boost your maturity, without the redundancy with EE127.

Tldr; only take one of them (not both). 

-------------------

Taking Math 110 and EE 127 right now. I don't think they're redundant, though they share things like spectral theorem and inner products. Work wise it's light as 127 homeworks are only biweekly and Math 110 this semester doesn't have graded homeworks. I'd recommend taking 127 concurrently with 189 or after it, it helps motivate the material in 127 more. 110 is very good because it'll help you understand the dynamical systems and Fourier transforms in 16b, inner product spaces of random variables in 126, spectral theorem in 127, and about stuff like diagonalization in general.

I am planning to take ee127 next semester to prep for 189, and I am considering adding math110 to my schedule. Will this be redundant? I heard ee 127 gives you sufficient mathematical background for 189, but I would like to do AI/ML and really get the most out of that class. I did not take 16B but took 16A and 54 and got A, A+. So if I have time to take both, how is taking math 110 along with ee 127?
history.subject: ee 127 + math 110
